entry.def: If you describe something as limitless, you mean that there is or appears to be so much of it that it will never be exhausted.

example.ex: ...a cheap and potentially limitless supply of energy...
example.tran: 廉价而且可能永远不会枯竭的能源供应

means.word_mean: 1. without limits in extent or size or quantity;
2. having no limits in range or scope;

sentences.sentence: "to start with a theory of unlimited freedom is to end up with unlimited despotism"- Philip Rahv

means.word_mean: 3. seemingly boundless in amount, number, degree, or especially extent;

auth_sentence.content: The Obama administration has limitless faith in unlimited government.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Obama administration has limitless faith in unlimited government.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Obama administration has limitless faith in unlimited government.

auth_sentence.content: It comes from savings that are not limitless.
